page.title: 15WALKINGTON CONCERNS,PART 2.
page.content: PUBLIC MEETINGS WERE ALSO HELD OVER THE RE_SITING OF THE TELEPHONE BOX TO ALLOW ACCESS TO RED GATES DEVELOPMENT. MAINLY USED BY LORRY DRIVERS SOME SAID IT SHOULD BE OUTSIDE THE VILLAGE TO REDUCE THE HAZARD OF PARKED LORRIES. OTHERS STILL WANTED VILLAGE BENEFIT BUT NOT OUTSIDE "THEIR" HOUSES.THE BOX FINALLY RESTS CLOSE TO IT'S OLD SITE, THANKFULLY PRESERVED,NOT MODERNISED. AT OVER 300 VEHICLES/hr USING THE B1230 VILLAGE STREET TO REACH THE M62; TRAFFIC SIZE,SPEED,EROSION OF VERGES AND POSSIBLE FUTURE ROAD WIDENING TO ADD TO SOME ALREADY DONE,WORRY 37% OF VILLAGERS.SPEED LIMITS ARE IGNORED AND PARKING OUTSIDE PUBS ADDS EXTRA DANGER THESE PUBS ARE A HUB OF ENTERTAINMENT CLOSE TO THE MUCH APPRECIATED VILLAGE HALL.CHEAPER TO HIRE THAN THE "SCHOOL" HALL PEOPLE BELIEVE IT HAS A BETTER ATMOSPHERE FOR LOCAL PERFORMANCES.
